item.description:
Let’s go see some more water falling. This small preserve with Bailey Brook has a series of cascades a half mile long. A wooded parcel, it is a quiet place for a short late summer hike. The Nature Conservancy purchased it for a bargain price.

There is limited parking, so car pooling will be appreciated.

This will be an easy walk of about 2 miles with a hill at the start. Social walking pace. We will be out for 1 hour. I have not visited this place in many years, and I will be following the trail map. Afterwards we will have a picnic lunch at a nearby park, if there is space there. The walk will be rescheduled if there is a threat of rain.

Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

Location: (Approximate address, no mailbox there) 291 Pond Rd, Franklin, CT. On route 207 across from Under the Mountain Rd.
